titlePart.text: SECTION E FIXED CONSTRUCTIONS
BUILDING
DOORS, WINDOWS, SHUTTERS, OR ROLLER BLINDS, IN GENERAL
LADDERS
FIXED OR MOVABLE CLOSURES FOR OPENINGS IN BUILDINGS, VEHICLES, FENCES, OR LIKE ENCLOSURES IN GENERAL, e.g. DOORS, WINDOWS, BLINDS, GATES
titlePart.entryReference: lids for car boots or bonnets

noteParagraph.text: "Wing" means a swingable, slidable or otherwise movable member such as a door or window, for closing an opening.
The term "wing frame" denotes the peripheral edge or edges which define the outer border of the wing.

Combinations of wings or frames with operating, mounting, latching or locking means of the type found in class are covered by the appropriate sub-class in class , except such as are covered by groups , , or of this sub-class.
For vehicle door or window arrangements, attention is drawn to the note following the title of sub-class .
